resources.string: This app uses the Ver-ID SDK to detect and recognize faces in ID cards captured using Microblink\'s BlinkID SDK.\n\nScan your ID card. Ver-ID will detect your face on the front of the ID card. Ver-ID will then proceed to capture your face and compare it to the face on the ID card.
1. Scan your ID card\n2. Compare the face on \nthe ID card to a selfie
Intellicheck verifies data from ID cards. Contact Applied Recognition for an API key.
The front and the back of the licence don\'t seem to match.
Failed to save an image of the ID card.
Failed to detect a face in the ID card.
Failed to collect image of the card.

The face matching score (%1$.01f) indicates a likelihood of %2$.5f%% that the person on the ID card is the same person as the one in the selfie. We recommend a threshold of %3$.01f for a positive identification when comparing faces from identity cards.

The face matching score %1$.01f indicates that the person on the ID card is likely NOT the same person as the one in the selfie. We recommend a threshold of %2$.01f for a positive identification when comparing faces from identity cards.

Ver-ID uses machine learning to calculate an authenticity score. The score between 0.0 and 1.0 indicates the authenticity of the document holder\'s image. Higher scores mean a lesser chance that the image has been tampered with.\n\nThis scan\'s score of %1$s suggests that the document %2$s authentic.

The score indicates how well the information on the front of the document matches the information on the barcode. The comparison uses a fuzzy string matching algorithm.\n\nIn this scan, %1$s of the information on the front matches the barcode.
